description:
Clavispora lusitaniae ATCC 42720 is a species of yeast that belongs to the phylum Ascomycota. It is a unicellular eukaryotic organism that reproduces asexually through budding. 

Clavispora lusitaniae ATCC 42720 is an anamorphic (asexual) form of the sexual species Clavispora opuntiae. It is a haploid organism, meaning it has a single set of chromosomes in its nucleus.

This yeast species is known to be found in various environmental sources, including soil, water, and the surfaces of plants. It has been isolated from a variety of substrates and has been studied for its potential applications in biotechnology, such as the production of enzymes or other metabolites.

Morphologically, Clavispora lusitaniae ATCC 42720 is characterized by its ovoid to elongated cell shape and the presence of budding scars on the cell surface. It is typically white or cream-colored and forms smooth, glistening colonies on growth media.

Physiologically, this yeast species is known to be able to assimilate and ferment a range of carbohydrates, and it can grow in a variety of environmental conditions, such as different temperatures and pH levels.

Overall, Clavispora lusitaniae ATCC 42720 is a well-studied yeast species that has potential applications in various fields of biotechnology and microbiology.
